alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued September 13 at 7:50PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE ... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. This will be the last outlook issued for this potential rainfall event. Tropical Depression 16W continues to move slowly to the northeast, and is located 755 miles to the northwest of Saipan. It`s forecast to continue to move ever so slowly to the northeast over the next 48 hours. As it does so, a south to southwesterly monsoon flow will persist across the Marianas and the CNMI over the next few days, with another weak circulation potentially developing Friday near Pagan, which could extend the monsoon flow duration into the weekend. As for rainfall totals issued in earlier forecasts, they remain on track; an area-wide 3 to 5 inches of rainfall, with locally higher amounts possible, still forecast to occur between late tonight and Friday. However, these amounts are slightly below Flash Flood Watch issuance thresholds. That said, some flash flood warnings or flood advisories remain a possibility during this time. Closely monitor this developing situation in the event watches, advisories, or warnings are needed. Forecasts will likely change in the next few days. Make sure nearby storm drains are not clogged, especially for low-lying or flood-prone areas.
